<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 309, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[770, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 325, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 662, 96]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Sketch the graph of \(y=|3 x-2 a|\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 513, 144, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 510, 618, 529]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence or otherwise solve the inequality \(\left|3 x-2 a\right|<x+5 a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 534, 95]]<|/det|>
2 Solve the equation \(2 \ln (2 x+3)-\ln (2 x+5)=\ln (3 x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 89, 99, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 428, 120]]<|/det|>
3 Find the exact value of \(\int_{\frac{1}{5} \pi}^{\frac{1}{4} \pi} 3 \cos ^{2} 5 x \mathrm{~d} x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 500, 98]]<|/det|>
4 (a) It is given that \(z_{1}=r_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta_{1}}\) and \(z_{2}=r_{2} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta_{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 108, 374, 128]]<|/det|>
Show that \((z_{1} z_{2})^{*}=z_{1} * z_{2}^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 511, 144, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 508, 727, 528]]<|/det|>
(b) \(z=3 \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4} \pi \mathrm{i}}\) is a root of the equation \(z^{2}+b z+c=0\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 540, 596, 559]]<|/det|>
State the other root and hence find the values of \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 448, 97]]<|/det|>
5 The equation of a curve is \(x y+y^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-x}=4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 125, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 112, 361, 151]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=\frac{y^{2}-y \mathrm{e}^{x}}{x \mathrm{e}^{x}+2 y}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 660, 144, 677]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 657, 616, 677]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the gradients of the tangents to the curve when \(x=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 81, 99, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 918, 121]]<|/det|>
6 Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z+4}{z+4 \mathrm{i}}\) is real and \(|z|=\sqrt{10}\) ．Give your answers in the form \(z=x+\mathrm{i} y\) ，where \(x\) and \(y\) are real．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 82, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 584, 107]]<|/det|>
7 Let \(\mathrm{f}(x)=\frac{3 a-5 x}{(3 a+2 x)(2 a-x)}\) ，where \(a\) is a positive constant．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 123, 144, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 121, 410, 139]]<|/det|>
（a）Express \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in partial fractions．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 918, 95]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 712, 144, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 710, 702, 727]]<|/det|>
(c) State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion in part (b) is valid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 564, 96]]<|/det|>
8 (a) Prove the identity \(\cot ^{2} \theta-\tan ^{2} \theta \equiv 4 \cot 2 \theta \csc 2 \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 695, 97]]<|/det|>
（b）Hence solve the equation \(\cot ^{2} x-\tan ^{2} x=5\) sec \(2 x\) for \(0^{\circ}<x<90^{\circ}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 753, 91]]<|/det|>
9 With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A, B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[274, 100, 725, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}, \quad \overrightarrow{O B}=\mathbf{i}+3 \mathbf{j}-2 \mathbf{k} \quad \text { and } \quad \overrightarrow{O C}=2 \mathbf{i}-\mathbf{j}+3 \mathbf{k} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 388, 153]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) passes through \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 168, 144, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 166, 377, 184]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a vector equation for \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 508, 144, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 505, 590, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) The point \(P\) is the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 536, 388, 555]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 518, 144, 535]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 516, 452, 535]]<|/det|>
(c) The point \(D\) is the reflection of \(A\) in \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 548, 390, 566]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 116, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 74, 533, 91]]<|/det|>
10 The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 95, 601, 128]]<|/det|>
\[
\sin 4 y \frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=x \sin 2 y \sin 3 x
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 420, 155]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y=\frac{1}{12} \pi\) when \(x=\frac{1}{2} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 168, 144, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 166, 688, 185]]<|/det|>
(a) Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\) and \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 520, 144, 536]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 515, 601, 537]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(0<y<\frac{1}{2} \pi\), find the values of \(y\) when \(x=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 91, 621, 230]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 255, 918, 288]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y=\sqrt{x} \sin 2 x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x=a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 303, 144, 319]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 301, 344, 319]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that \(\tan 2 a=-4 a\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 734, 144, 751]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 733, 484, 751]]<|/det|>
(b) Show by calculation that \(0.9<a<0.95\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 655, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that if a sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 98, 601, 127]]<|/det|>
\[
x_{n+1}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\pi-\tan ^{-1}\left(4 x_{n}\right)\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 135, 420, 152]]<|/det|>
converges, then it converges to \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 505, 144, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 504, 918, 536]]<|/det|>
(d) Use the iterative formula in part (c) to calculate \(a\) correct to 4 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 88]]<|/det|>
